Column Comment.0: SPATIAL PARCELOFFSHORE LOCATION: an ennumerated list of the parcelsincluded in the Offshore Survey system. These parcels may be referenced whendescribing the spatial extent of a business object such as a land right, field or pool.
Column Comment.1: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.2: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area such as a country, province, projectarea, area of interest, offshore area, district etc.
Column Comment.3: AREA TYPE ID: Unique identifier for the type of area, such as country, state, AOI etc.
Column Comment.4: BLOCK ADDITION: Alpha prefix to the block number ("A" in OCS addition areas).
Column Comment.5: BLOCK MODIFIER: Alpha character suffix on the block number distinguishing it fromothers in the same area.
Column Comment.6: COORDINATE SYSTEM ID: unique identifier for the coordinate system.
Column Comment.7: DESCRIPTION: Describes areas which are only partially included in the land parcelsmallest unit described (such as quarter LSD for DLS survey system)
Column Comment.8: EFFECTIVE DATE: Date on which the land parcel became effective
Column Comment.9: EAST-WEST DIRECTION: A reference table identifying valid East-West directions.For example, East, West.
Column Comment.10: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.11: GRID BLOCK RANGE: Number identifying the block increasing east or west of theprincipal meridian.
Column Comment.12: GRID BLOCK TIER: Number identifying the block increasing north or south of thebaseline.
Column Comment.13: NORTH-SOUTH DIRECTION: A reference table identifying valid north-southDirections. For example, North, South.
Column Comment.14: OUTER CONTINENTAL SHELF NUMBER: Number assigned to all offshore wells inFederal territory, on the Outer Continental Shelf .
Column Comment.15: OFFSHORE AREA CODE: The offshore area code used for US offshore welllocations.
Column Comment.16: OFFSHORE BLOCK: Number identifying the offshore oil and gas concession areadefined by its longitude and latitude, a subdivision of an OCS area.
Column Comment.17: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.18: REFERENCE PLAN NUM: Reference to a map prepared by a surveyor which showsthe land block in question
Column Comment.19: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.20: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.21: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION: The surface and sub-surface description of any object thatoccupies an area, such as a land right, field, facility or area of interest. The surfacedescription may be stated in terms of a legal survey system, metes and bounds orpolygon. The mineral zone description describes the minerals (substances) andsubsurface definition (zones/formations) that are included in the definition. For landrights, continuations may be described by generating a new Spatial description.NOTE: In this table, the FK is added to allow you to describe the polygonal outline fora parcel.
Column Comment.22: SPATIAL DESCRIPTION OBSERVATION NUMBER: a unique series number for thespatial description, allowing the spatial description to be versioned over time.
Column Comment.23: UTM QUADRANT: Number identifying the alpha UTM quadrant, UTM zone number,and UTM numeric quadrant (e.g., NG15-2).
Column Comment.24: WATER BOTTOM ZONE: The water bottom zone. This code is retained in Louisianaas special allowable area or zone.
Column Comment.25: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.26: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.27: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.28: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.29: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.30: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.31: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
